series_title: Certification: Chemistry and Reciprocal Lab Certification Records
series_description: This series documents the inspection and certification of laboratories that test drinking water per requirements in the Federal Safe Drinking Water Act and Virginia Health Department. Laboratories meeting requirements are issued a three-year certificate. This series includes a letter of certification, certification request, field notes, checklists, performance evaluation reports, and correspondence.
retention_statement: 7 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents the inspection and certification of laboratories that test drinking water per requirements in the Federal Safe Drinking Water Act and Virginia Health Department. Laboratories meeting requirements for microbiology certification are issued a five-year certificate. This series includes a letter of certification, certification request, notes, checklists, performance evaluation reports, and correspondence.
retention_statement: 7 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents the inspection and certification of laboratories that perform Milk Testing per FDA guidelines. Laboratories meeting requirements for milk certification are certified for two years. This series includes a letter of certification, certification request, field notes, checklists, performance evaluation reports, and correspondence.
retention_statement: 5 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents analyses performed on various commodities. Includes the technical data requested, tests performed, signature of person performing the evaluation, and the date.
retention_statement: 2 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series consists of container request forms (DGS-22-033 and DGS-22-037) documenting orders for NBS testing.
retention_statement: 10 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents the preparation and shipment of kits or laboratory containers used to return samples for testing in the laboratories. The request documents the type of container, number, and to whom it is shipped.
retention_statement: 2 Years after end of calendar year

series_title: Laboratory Records: ABO-Rh Reports and Test Files
series_description: This series documents the receipt of all samples for analysis and the issuing of a report of findings. Includes laboratory procedures, analyses, QC, worksheets, and reports with ABO-Rh laboratory testing and reporting.
retention_statement: 5 Years after end of calendar year

series_title: Laboratory Records: Environmental and Radiochemistry Reports and Test Files
series_description: This series documents the receipt and analysis of samples associated with environmental and radiochemistry testing, as well as laboratory/analytical procedures, quality control measures, and findings. This series may include, but is not limited to: reports, worksheets, receipts, and forms.
retention_statement: 10 Years after approval

series_title: Laboratory Records: Newborn Screen Reports and Test Files
series_description: This series documents the receipt of all samples for analysis and the issuing of a report of findings. Includes laboratory procedures, analyses, QC, and worksheets associated with an analysis. Refer to
retention_statement: 10 Years after end of calendar year

series_title: Laboratory Records: OSHA Reports and Test Files
series_description: This series documents the receipt of all samples for analysis and the issuing of a report of findings. Includes laboratory procedures, analyses, QC, worksheets, and reports with laboratory testing and reporting for OSHA (Occupational Safety & Health Administration)
retention_statement: 5 Years after end of calendar year

series_title: Laboratory Records: Requiring Chain of Custody Form
series_description: This series documents the chain of custody of all samples submitted for analysis, as well as laboratory/analytical procedures, and quality control measures. This series may include, but is not limited to: reports, worksheets, receipts, and forms.
retention_statement: 10 Years after approval

series_title: Laboratory Records: Routine Work Audited by the CLIA
series_description: This series documents the receipt of all samples for analysis and the issuing of a report of findings. Includes routine laboratory procedures, analyses, QC, worksheets, and reports associated with laboratory testing and reporting. There is no pending legal action and no MOA requiring records to be retained for a specified period of time. Records are needed for CLIA certification and are audited every two years.
retention_statement: 2 Years after creation

series_title: Laboratory Records: Routine Work Audited by the EPA
series_description: This series documents the receipt of all samples for analysis and the issuing of a report of findings. Includes routine laboratory procedures, analyses, QC, worksheets, and reports associated with laboratory testing. These analyses did not detect violations, will not require regulatory or legal action, and are not mandated by an MOA to be retained for a specified period of time. Records are needed for EPA certification and audited every 3 years.
retention_statement: 3 Years after creation

series_title: Laboratory Records: Routine Work Performed for State Agencies
series_description: This series documents the receipt of all samples for analysis and the issuing of a report of findings for work performed for state agencies in accordance with a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) or Memorandum of Agreement (MOA). Includes laboratory procedures, analyses, QC, worksheets, reports.
retention_statement: 5 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents the receipt of all samples for analysis and the issuing of a report of findings. Includes laboratory procedures, analyses, QC, worksheets, and reports with Safe Drinking Water Act (SDWA) laboratory testing and reporting.
retention_statement: 5 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents the receipt of all samples for analysis and the issuing of a report of findings. Includes laboratory procedures, analyses, QC, worksheets, and reports with SDWA laboratory testing and reporting
retention_statement: 5 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents the arrival of samples for analysis and the distribution of those samples to the various laboratories. Records date when NBS samples are received by the laboratory and the numbers assigned to those samples.
retention_statement: 10 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents the arrival of samples for analysis and the distribution of those samples to the various laboratories. Records date when samples are received by the laboratory the numbers assigned to those samples.
retention_statement: 0 Years after no longer administratively useful

series_description: This series documents the performance of various laboratory procedures and the results of product evaluations submitted the Division of Purchases and Supply in connection to the Lottery Department's games and techniques. Includes product analysis report, technical data requested, tests performed, signature of person performing the evaluation, and the date.
retention_statement: 3 Years after end of state fiscal year

series_description: This series documents health care services, whether physical mental, rendered by direct or indirect patient-provider which is used as a mechanism for tracking the patient's health care status. Includes those employee medical records not subject to the longer retention period stated in series 100925, "Safety Program: Employee Exposure Records. Refer to
retention_statement: 10 Years after last action
legal_citation: 29 CFR 1910.20 and Code of Virginia ยง42.1-79.1.

series_description: This series documents performance evaluation of laboratory procedures for tests involving drinking water, mandated by the SDWA. These studies are conducted four times each year. Includes copies of reports, statistical data, and
retention_statement: 6 Years after event

series_description: This series consists of certificates awarded because of successful completion of proficiency evaluation studies. Licenses issued because of compliance with federal and state requirements.
retention_statement: 0 Years after superseded, obsolete, or rescinded

series_description: This series documents audits of work procedures in each laboratory as part of the Division's Quality Assurance Plan. report of findings is made to the DGS Director of Laboratories writing and orally. Includes field notes, drafts, copies of audit reports, correspondence and memoranda.
retention_statement: 2 Years after end of calendar year

series_title: Regulated Medical and Hazardous Waste Manifest
series_description: This series documents the collection, transport, and disposal medical and hazardous waste. Refer to
retention_statement: 5 Years after end of calendar year
legal_citation: 40 CFR 265.74, 40 262, and Virginia Administrative Code 9 VAC20-120-10.

series_description: This series documents the measurement and monitoring of employee exposure to hazardous substances. This includes employee medical records that document hazardous Refer to
retention_statement: 30 Years after separation

series_title: Safety Program: Hazard Communication Standard for Hygiene Plan
series_description: This series documents communications to employees about hazards in the workplace and how to protect oneself from hazards.
retention_statement: 0 Years after superseded, obsolete, or rescinded

series_description: This series documents investigations of hazardous incidents or accidents that occur, investigations, recommendations and corrective actions taken as a result of the incident. Includes report of accident, injury, or condition, investigator's notes, hospital or physician's reports, and other documents that to the investigation. Refer to
retention_statement: 30 Years after separation

series_description: This series documents follow-up investigations, recommendations, and corrective actions taken as a result of accidents or hazardous incidents.
retention_statement: 5 Years after closed

series_description: This series documents that employee safety training is being conducted and that employees are aware of the hazards in work place. Includes documentation of hazard training Bloodborne Pathogens, handling regulated medical and hazardous waste, and the Chemical Hygiene Plan.
retention_statement: 2 Years after creation

series_description: This series consists of statistical data related to special and of general concern to the Division and is used to measure laboratory performance, costs, workload, productivity, etc. Includes statistical worksheets, reference materials, correspondence, and reports.
retention_statement: 2 Years after no longer administratively useful

series_description: This series documents current procedures and methods used perform various laboratory analyses. The records are retained for reference and as evidence of maintaining current technical procedures as part of the registration process of laboratories.
retention_statement: 10 Years after superseded, obsolete, or rescinded
